AVEVA Group Plc (Aveva) has completed the acquisition of OSIsoft, LLC, a US-based provider of data infrastructure software for the management of real-time data and events for process-intensive industries, for a purchase consideration of US$5 billion. OSIsoft is currently owned by Estudillo Holdings Corp (50.3% stake); SB/OSI, Inc. (SoftBank) (44.7% stake), a company owned by SoftBank Group; and MDT Holdings Inc, a company owned by Mitsui Group (5% stake). As part of the transaction, 13,655,570 ordinary shares of 3.56 pence each in the capital of Aveva were allotted and issued to Estudillo, and approximately $4.4 billion was paid in cash, which was funded by a combination of $3.5 billion from the proceeds of the proposed rights issue and $0.9 billion from existing cash on balance sheet and new debt facilities, resulting in pro forma net leverage of 1.9x EBITDA for the enlarged group. OSIsoft sells software into sectors including oil and gas, utilities and pharmaceutical development. Lazard & Co., Limited, Numis Securities Limited and J.P. Morgan Securities plc acted as financial advisors; while Latham & Watkins LLP, Ashurst LLP and Debevoise & Plimpton LLP acted as the legal advisers to AVEVA in the transaction. Morgan Stanley and Co. LLC acted as financial advisor. while Fenwick & West and Slaughter and May acted as legal advisors to OSIsoft in the transaction. The transaction enables Aveva to grow and diversify the industries it serves as well as continue to expand its footprint in existing and new markets and geographies. Commenting on the agreement, Craig Hayman, CEO of AVEVA, said: "Combining AVEVA and OSIsoft is yet another significant milestone in our journey to achieving the ambitious growth goals that we have set. This will not only help us serve existing customers better but also open the flood gates to new opportunities which will accelerate the delivery of our digitization vision. Data has been enabling organizations to more effectively determine the cause of problems by allowing them to visualize what is happening in different locations, departments and systems. This agreement will enable our customers to improve business processes as well as eliminate inefficiencies. We are extremely proud to be moving into the next chapter with an even stronger solutions portfolio as well as an ever-increasing and robust customer base which continues to make us leaders in our sector." OSIsoft founder and CEO Dr. J. Patrick Kennedy added: "Joining forces with AVEVA enhances and extends our ability to deliver on our key commitments to our customers, partners and employees. Together we will be better able to service the largest digital transformation projects in history, including across industry 4.0+ and IIoT. AVEVA's interest in OSIsoft is a testament to our talented team, and the extraordinary value of the PI System as the real-time streaming data infrastructure that powers the industrial world. Today's announcement is the culmination of a thoughtful search for a respected organization that would mesh with our own strong mission- and customer-driven culture. The next chapter in PI's fifth decade will be exciting for our employees and customers, and I look forward to my continued involvement in my new role as the largest individual shareholder in the combined company and as Chairman Emeritus to ensure we realize the full benefits of this transaction." Deal history Update 5: On March 18, 2021, Aveva announced that it has received all antitrust and regulatory clearances required for the transaction, including clearance by the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS). Update 4: On January 28, 2021, Aveva and OSIsoft will enter into a new period of up to 45 days to allow more time for review and discussion with CFIUS. During this period, the parties and CFIUS will continue to work to finalise an agreement related to the transaction. Update 3: On December 16, 2020, Aveva announced that it has received all antitrust and regulatory clearances required ahead of completion of the transaction with the exception of antitrust approvals in Austria and Brazil and the approval of the Committee on Foreign Investments in the United States (CFIUS). Update 2: On November 25, 2020, Aveva announced that it has cancelled the bridge loan made available for its acquisition of OSIsoft. Announced: On August 25, 2020, Aveva has entered into an agreement to acquire OSIsoft, for a purchase consideration of US$5 billion. Update 1: On June 23, 2020, Emerson Electric and Schneider Electric are among companies considering offer for OSIsoft, according to sources. Rumor: On May 27, 2020, SoftBank Vision Fund and J. Patrick Kennedy intends to sell minority stake in OSIsoft that could be worth more than $1.5 billion, according to sources familiar with the matter.

The transaction enables Aveva to grow and diversify the industries it serves as well as continue to expand its footprint in existing and new markets and geographies.
